author: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001
Teoderick Contreras, Splunk
description: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: The following analytic detects the creation of the /etc/at.allow or /etc/at.deny configuration files in Linux. It leverages file creation events from the Endpoint datamodel to identify when these files are created. This activity is significant as these files control user permissions for the "at" scheduling application and can be abused by attackers to establish persistence. If confirmed malicious, this could allow unauthorized execution of malicious code, leading to potential data theft or further system compromise. Analysts should review the file path, creation time, and associated processes to assess the threat.
false_positives: Administrator or network operator can create this file for automation purposes. Please update the filter macros to remove false positives.
name: Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001: Linux At Allow Config File Creation
note: Rule converted with Google Gemini 2.0 Flash 001
query:
sequence by host.name
  [process where event.type == "start" and process.name == "at"] 
  [file where event.type == "creation" and file.path in ("/etc/at.allow", "/etc/at.deny")]
